content: I'm a lecturer working in representation theory (of finite dimensional algebras and quivers) at Uppsala University, Sweden. Now trying to learn some basic things about proof verification. I currently find the tutorial "Mathematics in Lean" to be quite useful as an entry point (in the middle of the second chapter).
Welcome! Don't hesitate to post comments about MIL, it's in its very early stages.

I'm an assistant professor in computer science at Uppsala University, Sweden. I'm working on programming languages, especially type systems and formal semantics. I have previous experience with Rocq, but I'm looking into Lean since @Julian Külshammer is introducing Lean in his first-year Logic course, which means the students in my third-year Semantics course is going to know some Lean.
